pronunciation: CUBIT, [Latin , the elbow; signifying a turn or corner; Gr.]

definitions.text:
1. In anatomy, fore arm; ulna, and bone of arm from to wrist.
2. In mensuration, length of mans arm from to extremity of middle finger. The cubit among ancients was of different length among different nations. Dr. Arbuthnot states Roman cubit seventeen inches and four tenths; cubit of scriptures little less than 22 inches; and English cubit 18 inches.
